description: Abigail Grebe  added  3 new photos  — with  David L. Weaver  at  Jordan River Baptism Site . So I guess I need to backtrack a little bit.  On our second day in Israel Whilma, our EO liaison, delivered some sad news.  The leader of Educational Opportunities had passed away at his home.  We spent the day visiting major sites like Kasr el Yehud, Jericho, Qumran, lunch and the gift shop in the morning.  In the afternoon it was warmer for swimming in the warm water of the Dead Sea.  It was so nice there that I tried to hide with Kate, but we eventually came out, dressed and headed to the Jordan River.  Our tour guide was very helpful and he picked up gowns for anyone who had expressed interest the previous day and we donned them before approaching the water's edge that is now a wooden deck with steps leading into the water.  This was not a graceful process for me because the water was far colder than the 85 degrees I was initially told and the steps ended abruptly with a long step at the end.  Apparently, witnesses say I laughed as I was submerged and when I arose there were a couple of Asian women cheering and laughing around the same time.  My witness and I wonder if they knew what was happening.  After I came out, I was told that the water is actually melted snow water from the hills above.  Please excuse the obvious facial expressions that relay my shock.  Brrrr.   ❄️
